Package com.company

Class SaveHandler

java.lang.Object
com.company.SaveHandler
public final class SaveHandler
extends java.lang.Object
Manages all interactions with save data for the Snake game.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lucas Champoux, Trevor Martin, Raunak Shahi

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.io.File FILE
    The file to read and write high scores from.
    static int LIST_SIZE
    The number of high scores to be saved.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.util.List<java.lang.String> formatScores​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
    Takes a list of scores formatted in storage format and returns a list of the same scores formatted for output and view by the user.
    static java.lang.String[] loadHighScores()
    Reads the high scores from FILE, then builds a String[] representation of them.
    static boolean writeHighScore​(java.lang.String newScore)
    Adds the score passed in to FILE, in the correct position on the leaderboard, assuming it is within the top LIST_SIZE scores.
    static boolean writeNewHighScores()
    Writes a default set of high scores to initialize the file FILE.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • LIST_SIZE

      public static final int LIST_SIZE
      The number of high scores to be saved.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • FILE

      public static final java.io.File FILE
      The file to read and write high scores from.

  • Method Details

    • loadHighScores

      public static java.lang.String[] loadHighScores()
      Reads the high scores from FILE, then builds a String[] representation of them.
      Returns:
      an array containing the contents of FILE, each element in the format "SCORE,NAME". If FILE cannot be read, returns an array of all 0 scores.

    • writeNewHighScores

      public static boolean writeNewHighScores()
      Writes a default set of high scores to initialize the file FILE.
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise.

    • writeHighScore

      public static boolean writeHighScore​(java.lang.String newScore)
      Adds the score passed in to FILE, in the correct position on the leaderboard, assuming it is within the top LIST_SIZE scores.
      Parameters:
      newScore - The score to be added, formatted as "SCORE,NAME"
      Returns:
      true if successful, false otherwise.

    • formatScores

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> formatScores​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
      Takes a list of scores formatted in storage format and returns a list of the same scores formatted for output and view by the user.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of scores to be formatted.
      Returns:
      a list of the same scores formatted for output.
